channel.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
channel.description:
Folks, We held auditions for a new hgrunt voice a while back, and we have found our new actor, Michael Tsarouhas.
One of our primary goals during the rerecord is to also overhaul the hgrunt response rules.
[b]That’s where the Black Mesa Community Hivemind comes in [/b] The hgrunts have been referring to all of the various Xenians as "uglies", "bogies","aliens"... But those generic lines don't really help the player understand the particulars of the battlefield.
We want their reactions to the world around them to always provide valuable information to the player, especially in the middle of a chaotic combat sequence.
[b]We'd like your help creating unique names for every Xenian.[/b]
Ideally, names would either be descriptive enough to identify the interdimensional interlopers or inform the player of their attacks and tactics. (e.g. calling a Vort a "shocker")
Let's do one together. I’ll pull a critter off [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Category:Enemies']the wiki[/url]...
[b][url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Snarks']Snark[/url][/b]
[img]https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/images//b/b3/Worldmodel_snark.jpg[/img]
So, I'll pretend I'm either an hgrunt spotting one of these little monsters for the first time, or maybe I've just seen a swarm of these lil' guys consume a the rest of my squad.
[b]What do I say when I see these beaked bastards raining down from an open vent shaft?[/b]
[INDENT]Red Roach! Red Ant! Fire Ant! Bug Eye! Swarm! Tics! Tic Attack! Swarmers![/INDENT]
Just let out a stream of conscious spew of possible names. Give it a shot! It's fun.
[b]Submit whatever unique names comes to mind while perusing this [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Category:Enemies']GALLERY OF HORRORS[/url]:[/b]
* [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Headcrab']Headcrab[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Zombie']Zombie[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Snarks']Snark[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Barnacle']Barnacle[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Houndeye']Houndeye[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Bullsquid']Bullsquid[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Vortigaunt']Vortigaunt[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Alien_Grunt']Agrunt (Alien Grunt)[/url] * [url='https://wiki.blackmesasource.com/Gargantua']Gargantua[/url]
[b]We're looking for short, snappy, 1-2 word entries, not sentences! [/b]
Thanks, folks! The Black Mesa Team appreciates all of your continued support and contributions.
Benjamin Truman Story Lead - Script, Voice, Choreo [email]benjaminwtruman@gmail.com[/email] [url='https://twitter.com/BenjaminTruman']@BenjaminTruman[/url]

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Yep. Unfortunately, I annihilated his name trying to recite it for the overhead announcement recordings. I did 4 pronunciations for his name and I swear I probably STILL got it wrong. He is a gentleman though and has yet to diss me for it. :love:

Read full topic

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: Shaddy
item.description:
Headcrab: face-lifts, french-kissers

Zombie: bursted-chests, big-eaters

Snark: Little shits, flightless bees,

Barnacle: Tongues, Chokers,

Houndeye: Ear-blasters, Asshole Dog things, tripods

Bullsquid: Cthulus, snot-guzzlers,

Vortigaunt: Hand-dicks, Nameks, GOD. DAMNED. ALIENS.,

Alien grunt: enemy soldiers, buzz-shooters,

Gargantua: Dumptrucks, blue flames, friggin’ dragons, “yo momma”.

Just spitballin’ here, if people post any names here and you want two names for one enemy to both make it in, there could be one of those sections like the one in OaR where you can sneak behind soldiers who are arguing about what to call the different enemies.

Read full topic

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: Swaggless
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

Just a heads up folks, f-bombs and other strong curse words will not be used in game. But keep these coming, you guys have some awesome ideas!

I’m glad to hear that. Although that kind of language is nothing all of us haven’t heard before, HL always had a tradition of downplaying language, and to my mind, seems more mature in doing so.
It also makes Barney’s line right before the Citadel all the more powerful and exciting.

Read full topic
item.source: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Let me try for some tongue-in-cheek ones, in the spirit of soldiers trying to laugh about the absolute hell they’re going through.

Houndeye: Flashbang, Cockroach Spaniel, Fleabag, Mongrel, Bugeye, Nickelback
Bullsquid: Vomit Bag, Vomit Comet, Bad Mayo, Hangover, Glowin’ Blower, Retchin’ Randy, Pukin’ Peter, Belchin’ Bobby
Headcrab: Ex-Wife
Zombie: Vivi/Vivian, Ribeye, GIblet
Vortigaunt: Taser, Hunchback, Tesla, Zappy Dan, Shock Jock
Snark: Piranha, Flea, Nibbles
Alien Grunt: Chrome Dome, Lineman, Seahawk/Packer/Patriot/etc, Ex-Con
Gargantua: Laxative, Ex-Lax, Game Over
Tentacle: Cyrano, Banger, Cleaver, Boner*
Controller: Poindexter, Brainiac, Smarts, Balloon, Flying Fuck*
Barnacle: Frenchie, Groper, Licking Lesbo*, Slurp
Bounce Pad: Bloat, Toad, Airbag, Waterbed, Bouncy Castle
Manta: Raymond

*I forgive you for not using these.

item.source: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: Malidictus
item.description:
If we assume that Opposing Force is canon, the soldiers were sent into Black Mesa without actually being told what they were getting into. What this means to me is they wouldn’t have “official” names for the aliens and would instead call them as they see them. L4D2 did that when the survivors meet at first, call thing the Special infected things like “It’s one of those leaping-on-your-back bitches!” and “It’s that spitting thing!” My impression of military personnel is they don’t want to be poets in battle and would usually pick a simple, descriptive, easy-to-say name for things, so usually one word. With that in mind…

*Headcrab: Headcrab - that’s literally what it is. It looks like a crab and it jumps on your head. That’s how I’d describe one if I saw it.
*Headcrab Zombies: Zombie - again, that’s literally what they are. They walk like zombies, sound like zombies and act like zombies.
*Houndeye: Dog - they look and act like small alien dogs. We used to call them “the three-legged dogs” when I was a kid.
*Bullsquid: Spitter - while it’s tempting to go with “squid,” the Black Mesa version of these things has SUCH a trademark and unique spit as to be defined by it.
*Barnacle Creature: Tonge - that doesn’t necessarily describe the Barnacle Creature itself, but it’s what you see to know they’re on the ceiling and what gets you killed.
*Vortagaunt: Freak - of all the aliens in Half-Life, the Vortagaunt is the most difficult to sum up, so it would make sense that the soldiers would just call them “freaks” or “alien freaks.”
*Alien Grunt: Big Guy - not necessarily very descriptive, but I can imagine ever HECU marine would know EXACTLY who the “big guys” are.
*Snark: Bug - that’s what they look like. They’re giant, fast, aggressive “damn bugs.”
*Gargantua - That Thing - the Garg shows up twice in the entirety of Half-Life and not once in Opposing Force or Blue Shif. It’s safe to assume it’s very rare and something that the soldiers it kills haven’t seen before. “What the hell is that thing?!?” “How are we supposed to kill that thing?!?”

Read full topic
item.source: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: NioA
item.description:
• Headcrabs: “Head humpers!”, “Face huggers!”, “Latches!”
  • Zombie: “Corpse!”, “Mawman/men!”, “Undead!”
  • Snark: “Buggers!”, “Roaches!”, “Bugs!”
  • Barnacle: “Tongues!”, “Ropes!”
  • Houndeye: “K9s!”, “Lil’ Boomers!” , “Three Legs!”
  • Bullsquid: “Cthulu dog!”, “Cthulu Jr!”, “Acid launcher!”
  • Vortigaunt: “Zappers!”, “Charges!”, “Chains!”, “Collars!”
  • Alien Grunt: “Tank!”, “Hive men!”, “Armour!”, “Jacked Up!”
  • Gargantua: “Hulk!”, “Giant!”, “Godzilla!”, “Holy shit!”

Not really good with military terminology. Just based these off of my first experiences / thoughts when I first played Half-Life.

Read full topic

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: BlackStamp
item.description:
I am amazed at the consistent flow of good ideas from you folks…
In fact, this has become a much larger collection of ideas than I had imagined.

Is there anybody out there that would be willing to compile these in a web-based spreadsheet?
Any other ideas for organizing this info would be appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: M-Man
item.description:
A lot of these have been said before but:

Headcrab- mind fucker
Houndeye- Eyes
Vortigaunt- Shocker
Bullsquid- Squid-face
Gargantua- BIG MOTHER FUCKER
Manta Ray- Manta Ray (makes sense)
Alien Grunt- Steroids
Snark- bugs
Barnacle- tounge
zombie- zombie (who wouldn’t just say zombie?)

I feel like the HECU wouldn’t come up with elaborate names for these things, but instead just go with what the first thing that came to their minds was.

Read full topic

item.title: COMMUNITY PROJECT - [classified] HECU identification for Xenians
item.dc:creator: Ronster
item.description:
Let’s not forget this

In 1972, a scale of measurement was established for alien encounters. When a UFO is sighted, it is called an encounter of the first kind. When evidence is collected, it is known as an encounter of the second kind. When contact is made with extraterrestrials, it is the third kind. The next level, abduction, is the fourth kind.

Read full topic
